isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - IC BUS - BODY ELECTRICAL SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the ON position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: At "B" stud of cranking motor solenoid (J31), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in 4/0 red cable from battery, then repair.
At mega fuse junction feed stud and circuit 14, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in fusible links 14-FL, or 14A-FL and circuit 14, then repair.
Across the mega fuse posts, measure voltage.
Locate cause of overload condition, then replace mega fuse.
At body battery feed stud (J1), measure voltage from circuit 14 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 14, then repair.
At fuse panel (P1) circuit 6BLK18, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 6BLK18, then repair.
Body electrical power distribution circuits check good.
Fuse panel, are all fuses hot, using two shunts?
At fuse panel (P1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 6BLK18, then repair.
At fuse panel with shunt (P2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in shunt (P2), then repair.
At fuse panel with shunt (P3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in shunt (P3), then repair.
At fuse panel fuse 1 thru 40 sockets, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse 1 thru 40 sockets, then repair.
Fuse panel, are all fuses controlled using master disconnect?
At fuse panel (P1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 6BLK18, then repair.
At fuse panel (P1), circuit 6BLK18 to master solenoid (in) stud, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 6BLK18 to solenoid, then repair.
At fuse panel circuit 16BLK40 to master solenoid (control) stud, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40 to (control) solenoid, then repair.
Test master solenoid engages and disengages when key is turned ON and OFF, at solenoid (out) stud measure voltage to ground.
At fuse panel (P2) circuit 6BLK15 from master solenoid (out) stud, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 6BLK15, (P2), then repair.
At fuse panel circuit 6BLK3 to (P3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit 6BLK3, (P3), then repair.
At fuse panel fuse 1 thru 40 sockets, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse 1 thru 40 sockets, then repair.
Fuse panel, are all fuses controlled using noise kill disconnect?
At fuse panel (P1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 6BLK18, then repair.
At fuse panel (P1) circuit 6BLK18 to master solenoid (in) stud, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 6BLK18 to solenoid, then repair.
At fuse panel circuit 16BLK40 to solenoid (control) stud, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40 to (control) solenoid, then repair.
Test master solenoid engages and disengages when key is turned ON and OFF, at solenoid (out) stud measure voltage to ground.
At fuse panel (P2) circuit 6BLK15 from master solenoid (out) stud, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 6BLK15, (P2), then repair.
At fuse panel circuit 6BLK7 from master solenoid (out) stud to noise kill solenoid (in) stud, measure voltage to ground.
noise kill solenoid (in) stud to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 6BLK7 to solenoid, then repair.
At fuse panel circuit 16BLU69 to noise kill solenoid (control) stud, measure voltage to ground.
noise kill solenoid (control) stud to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU69 to (control) solenoid, then repair.
Test noise kill solenoid engages and disengages when key is turned ON and OFF, at solenoid (out) stud measure voltage to ground.
noise kill solenoid (out) stud to gnd.
At fuse panel circuit 6BLK18 from noise kill solenoid (out) stud to (P3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 6BLK18, (P3), then repair.
At fuse panel fuse 1 thru 40 sockets, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse 1 thru 40 sockets, then repair.
Flasher plate and harness check good.
At fuse panel (P1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in (P1), then repair.
Remove screws and pull fuse panel out from flasher plate to access output connectors. Disconnect connectors (A, B, C, D, E, F and G).
At fuse panel connector (A) pins (A1 thru A8), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse panel (P3), fuses 31 thru 38, then repair.
At fuse panel connector (B) pins (B1 and B2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse panel (P3), fuses 39 and 40, then repair.
At fuse panel connector (C) pins (C1 thru C10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse panel (P1), fuses 21 thru 30, then repair.
At fuse panel connector (D) pins (D1 thru D6), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse panel (P2), fuses 11 thru 16, then repair.
At fuse panel connector (E) pins (E1 thru E4), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse panel (P2), fuses 17 thru 20, then repair.
At fuse panel connector (F) pins (F1 and F2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse panel (P2), fuses 1 and 2, then repair.
At fuse panel connector (G) pins (G1 thru G8), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fuse panel (P2), fuses 3 thru 10, then repair, or replace fuse panel.
Reconnect connectors (A, B, C, D, E, F and G) to fuse panel, position fuse panel into flasher plate and install screws. Connect battery power and check fuses for tripped or blown condition.
Go to step 1 if first time fuse panel is replaced; if another failure, check external circuits for problem.
Check fuse panel fuse F1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Move master flasher switch ON and fuse F1 opens.
Locate cause of overload condition in F1, circuit 12BLK1, master flasher switch, circuit 12RED30, connectors (J8) and (C14), then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
All lights turn ON steady. After short time, circuit breaker trips or fuse blows.
Check for reverse polarity, locate cause of condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Neither amber or red lights flash, stop arm does not extend.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Neither amber or red lights flash, stop arm does not extend. Turn master and start switches ON. At circuit 12RED39, flasher module "start switch" terminal, pin 8, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 12BLK1, 12RED39 "master and start switches", connectors (J8), (C14), then repair.
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, check for open door switch circuit 16WHT70 to ground.
Locate cause of open door switch, circuit 16WHT70 condition, then repair.
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, at flasher module (Weldon) pin 9 or 10 "flash red", circuit 16WHT70, measure voltage to ground.
Check for reverse polarity, locate cause of circuit 16WHT70 condition, then repair.
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, check stop arm solenoid, circuit 16BLU63 at flasher module (Weldon) pin 5 "stop arm" to ground.
stop arm solenoid, circuit 16BLU63 to gnd.
Locate cause of stop arm solenoid, circuit 16BLU63 condition, then repair.
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, check red light outputs (Weldon) pins 4 and 6, circuits 12ORG9 and 12ORG8 to ground.
red light outputs, circuits 12ORG9 or 12ORG8 to gnd.
Locate cause of red light outputs, circuits 12ORG9 or 12ORG8 condition, then repair.

One pair of lights does not flash and/or stop arm waivers. Check that the non-flashing lights are properly connected to flasher and not shorted (Weldon) pins 3, 4, 6, 7, circuits 12ORG8, 12ORG9, 12ORG24, 12ORG25 to ground.
Locate cause of lights, circuits 12ORG8, 12ORG9, 12ORG24, 12ORG25 condition, then repair.

One pair of lights are on steady or stop arm is extended. Check that the main power to flasher is connected properly, circuit 12RED30 at (Weldon) pin 2, master switch, and the affected output is not shorted to +12 volts.
Locate cause of shorted circuit 12RED30 to +12 volts condition, then repair.
Lights flash erratically. Check for proper negative ground connection to the flasher ground terminal. circuit 16WHT at (Weldon) pin 11, ground.
Locate cause of proper negative circuit 16WHT at ground. condition, then repair. Replace flasher module.
Check fuse panel fuse F1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Move master flasher switch ON and fuse F1 opens.
Locate cause of overload condition in F1, circuit 12BLK1, master flasher switch, circuit 12RED30, connectors (J8) and (C14), then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
All lights turn ON steady. After short time, circuit breaker trips or fuse blows.
Check for reverse polarity, locate cause of condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Neither amber or red lights flash, stop arm does not extend.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Neither amber or red lights flash, stop arm does not extend. Turn master and start switches ON. At circuit 12RED39, flasher module "start switch" terminal, pin 6, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 12BLK1, 12RED39 "master and start switches", connectors (J8), (C14), then repair. Replace (ELS) flasher relay "L".
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, check for open door switch circuit 16WHT70 to ground.
Locate cause of open door switch, circuit 16WHT70 condition, then repair.
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, check stop arm solenoid, circuit 16BLU63 at flasher module (ELS) pin 1 to ground.
stop arm solenoid, circuit 16BLU63 to gnd.
Locate cause of stop arm solenoid, circuit 16BLU63 condition, then repair.
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, at flasher module (ELS) pin 3 "door sw", circuit 16WHT70, measure voltage to ground.
Check for reverse polarity, locate cause of circuit 16WHT70 condition, then repair. Replace (ELS) flasher relay "S".
Amber lights turn off, but red lights do not flash when door is open, check red light outputs (ELS) pins 9 and 10, circuits 12ORG9 and 12ORG8 to ground.
red light outputs, circuits 12ORG9 or 12ORG8 to gnd.
Locate cause of red light outputs, circuits 12ORG9 or 12ORG8 condition, then repair.

One pair of red lights does not flash and/or stop arm waivers. Check that the non-flashing lights are properly connected to flasher and not shorted (ELS) pins 9 and 10, circuits 12ORG8, 12ORG9 to ground.
Locate cause of red lights, circuits 12ORG8, 12ORG9 condition, then repair. Replace (ELS) flasher relay "R".

One pair of amber lights does not flash and/or stop arm waivers. Check that the non-flashing lights are properly connected to flasher and not shorted (ELS) pins 7 and 8, circuits 12ORG24, 12ORG25 to ground.
amber lights, circuits RG24, 12ORG25 to gnd.
Locate cause of amber lights, circuits 12ORG24, 12ORG25 condition, then repair. Replace (ELS) flasher relay "A".

One pair of lights are on steady or stop arm is extended. Check that the main power to flasher is connected properly, circuit 12RED30 at (ELS) pins 4, master switch, and the affected outout is not shorted to +12 volts.
Locate cause of shorted circuit 12RED30 to +12 volts condition, then repair.
Lights flash erratically. Check for proper negative ground connection to the flasher ground terminal, circuit 16WHT at (ELS) pins 5, ground.
Locate cause of proper negative circuit 16WHT at ground condition, then repair. Replace flasher module.
Check fuseblock fuse F11 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
At flasher plate, fuse F11, circuit 16LTBL6 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16LTBL6, connector (J26), then repair.
At left hand switch panel, circuit 16BLK40 and connector (J54), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, connector (J54), then repair.
Move master disconnect switch ON. At circuit 16BLK40A and connector (J54), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40A, connector (J54), then repair.
Master disconnect switch ON. At circuit 16BLK40A, master disconnect solenoid control terminal, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40A, master disconnect solenoid control terminal, then repair.
Check master disconnect switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace switch.

table.title: Accessory Feed-Rear, Left and Right Emergency Exit Door Switches

entry.para: Check fuseblock fuse F11 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
At flasher plate, fuse F11, circuit 16BLK40 and terminal board (TB3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, terminal board (TB3), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK40 and driver buzzer, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, driver buzzer, then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16PNK5, driver buzzer and connector (J6), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK5, driver buzzer, connector (J6), then repair.
At left hand body harness, circuit 16PNK5 and connector (J10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK5 and connector (J10), then repair.
Check rear emergency exit door closed switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace switch.
Rear emergency exit door switch checks good.
Check left hand side and right hand side emergency exit doors, closed switches for open condition.
left hand side and right hand side emergency exit door switches.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace Switch.
Left hand side and right hand side emergency exit door switches check good.

entry.para: Check fuseblock fuse F11 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
At flasher plate, fuse F11, circuit 16BLK40 and terminal board (TB3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, terminal board (TB3), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK40 and driver buzzer, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, driver buzzer, then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16PNK14, driver buzzer and connector (J6), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK14, driver buzzer, connector (J6), then repair.
At left hand body harness, circuit 16PNK14 and connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK14 and connector (J9), then repair.
Check circuit 16PNK14 and left and right body kick-out emergency windows closed switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace Switch.
Kick-out emergency window switches check good.
At flasher plate, circuit 16PNK57, driver buzzer and connector (J6), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK57, driver buzzer, connector (J6), then repair.
Check roof hatch closed switches for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace switch.

Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.

Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, terminal board (TB3), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK40 and driver buzzer, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, driver buzzer, then repair.
At flasher plate, terminal board (TB3), circuit 16BLK40 and connector (J15), measure voltage to ground.

At left body, circuit 16BLK40, 3" red light over left emergency door and connector (J10), measure voltage to ground.
16BLK40, 3" red light over left emergency door, (J10), to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, 3" red light over left emergency door, connector (J10), then repair.
At rear cap, circuit 16BLK40, 3" red light over rear emergency door and connector (J11), measure voltage to ground.
16BLK40, 3" red light over rear emergency door, (J11), to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, 3" red light over rear emergency door, connector (J11), then repair.
At right body, circuit 16BLK40, 3" red light over right emergency door, measure voltage to ground.
16BLK40, 3" red light over right emergency door, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, 3" red light over right emergency door, then repair.
Check 3" red light over left, rear and right emergency doors, for open condition.
3" red light over left, rear and right emergency doors.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace lamp or switch.
3" red light over left, rear and right emergency doors checks good.
Check fuseblock fuse F11 for open condition.

16BLK40, emergency exit indicator light, to gnd.

At right hand switch panel, circuit 16PNK5, emergency exit indicator light, and connector (J3), measure voltage to ground.
16PNK5, emergency exit indicator light, (J3), to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK5, emergency exit indicator light, connector (J3), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16PNK5, driver buzzer, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK5, driver buzzer, then repair.
Check emergency exit indicator light, for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace lamp.
Emergency exit indicator light checks good.
Check fuseblock fuse F11 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
At flasher plate, fuse F11, circuit 16BLK40 and terminal board (TB3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, terminal board (TB3), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK40 and driver buzzer, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, driver buzzer, then repair.
At flasher plate, terminal board (TB3), circuit 16BLK40 and connector (J83), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, connector (J83), then repair.
At right hand switch panel, circuit 16BLK40, noise kill switch ON, connector (C38), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK40, noise kill switch, connector (C38), then repair.
At right hand switch panel, circuit 16BLU69, noise kill switch ON, connector (C83), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU69, noise kill switch, connector (C83), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLU69, noise kill switch ON, at noise kill solenoid control terminal, measure voltage to ground.
16BLU69, noise kill solenoid control terminal to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU69, noise kill solenoid control terminal, then repair.
Check noise kill switch, for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace switch.
Check fuseblock fuse F16 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Turn key ON and with transmission in reverse, fuse F16, measure voltage at connector (194) from circuit 71A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71A, connector (194), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLU83 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83, connector (J26), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLU83 and connector (J15), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83, connector (J15), then repair.
At left hand body, circuit 16BLU83 and connector (J10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83, connector (J10), then repair.
At rear cap, circuit 16BLU83 to left back-up light, measure voltage to ground.
16BLU83 to left back-up light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83 to left back-up light, then repair. Replace lamp.
At rear cap, circuit 16BLU83 to right back-up light, measure voltage to ground.
16BLU83 to right back-up light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83 to right back-up light, then repair. Replace lamp.
At sealed engine harness, circuit 16BLU83A and connector (J3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83A, connector (J3), then repair.
At sealed engine harness, circuit 16BLU83A and connector (SS14), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83A, connector (SS14), then repair.
At sealed engine harness, circuit 16BLU83A and connector (SS15), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83A, connector (SS15), then repair.
At under body rear most crossmember, circuit 16BLU83A to back-up alarm horn, measure voltage to ground.
16BLU83A to back-up alarm horn, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU83A to back-up alarm horn, then repair. Replace horn.
Back-up light and alarm horn check good.
Check fuseblock fuse F14 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Turn key to ON, fuse 14, measure voltage at connector (194), from circuit 13F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13F, connector (194), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK83 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83, connector (J26), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK83A and connector (J1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83A, connector (J1), then repair.
Move air door dump ON, circuit 16BLK83A, at air door dump valve switch, measure voltage to ground.
16BLK83A, air door dump valve switch to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83A, air door dump valve switch, then repair.
Check air door dump valve switch, on dash panel, circuit 16BLK83A to 16BLK19, connector (J1), measure resistance from connector (J1).
Replace air door dump valve switch.
Air door dump ON, circuit 16BLK19, left hand body connector (J71), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK19, connector (J71), then repair.
Air door dump ON, circuit 16BLK19, front cap connector (J72), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK19, connector (J72), then repair.
Air door dump ON, circuit 16BLK19, right side over door dump valve, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK19, dump valve, then repair. Replace dump valve.
Dump valve switch and valve check good.
Check fuseblock fuse F14 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Turn key to ON, fuse 14, measure voltage at connector (194), from circuit 13F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13F, connector (194), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK83 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83, connector (J26), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK83 and connector (J70), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83, connector (J70), then repair.
On accessory panel, move air door control to open (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK20, connector (J70), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK20, connector (J70), then repair. Replace switch.
Air door control in open (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK20, left body connector (J71), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK20, connector (J71), then repair.
Air door control in open (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK20, front cap connector (J72), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK20, connector (J72), then repair.
Air door control in open (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK20, over door in-line connector to red wire open door solenoid, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK20, red wire open door solenoid, then repair. Replace solenoid.
On accessory panel, move air door control to close (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK83B, connector (J70), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83B, connector (J70), then repair. Replace switch.
Air door control in close (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK83, left body connector (J15), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK20, connector (J15), then repair.
Air door control in close (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK83, left body connector (J71), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK20, connector (J71), then repair.
Air door control in close (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK83, front cap connector (J72), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83, connector (J72), then repair.
Air door control in close (2 or 3 position control), circuit 16BLK83, over door in-line connector to red wire close door solenoid, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83, red wire close door solenoid, then repair. Replace solenoid.
Air door control switch and solenoids check good.
Check fuseblock fuse F14 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Turn key to ON, fuse 14, measure voltage at connector (194), from circuit 13F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 13F, connector (194), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK83 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83, connector (J26), then repair.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLK83A and connector (J1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83A, connector (J1), then repair.
At air compressor relay, circuit 16BLK83, relay terminal 85, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK83, relay terminal 85, then repair. Replace relay.
Check fuse panel fuse F20 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
At air compressor relay, circuit 16BLK65, relay terminal 30, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK65, relay terminal 30, then repair. Replace relay.
At flasher plate, circuit 16BLU65 and connector (R2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU65, connector (R2), then repair.
At sealed engine harness, circuit 16BLU65 and connector (E53), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU65, connector (E53), then repair.
At blue wire on air compressor, measure voltage to ground.
blue wire air compressor to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in blue wire air compressor, then repair. Replace air compressor.
Air compressor and relay checks good.
Check fuseblock fuse F1 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Turn headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set, fuse 28, at body builder conn. (194) and circuit 62F, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62F, then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16DKBL and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16DKBL, connector (J26), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16DKBL and terminal board (TB2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16DKBL, connector (TB2), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37A and connector (J8), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37A, connector (J8), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37A, switch panel, panel light illumination, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37A, panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37B and connector (J7), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37B, connector (J7), then repair.

Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37B, panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37C and connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37C, connector (J9), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37C, switch panel, panel light illumination, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37C, panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37 and connector (J10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, connector (J10), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37, switch panel, panel light illumination, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37 and connector (J11), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, connector (J11), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37, switch panel, panel light illumination, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37 and connector (J12), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, connector (J12), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37, switch panel, panel light illumination, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37D and connector (J1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37D, connector (J1), then repair.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37, connector (C4), switch panel, panel light illumination, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, connector (C4), panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Headlight switch (23) ON and rheostat set. At flasher plate, circuit 16VIO37, connector (C1), switch panel, panel light illumination, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16VIO37, connector (C1), panel light illumination, then repair. Replace switch.
Panel lights and switch illumination circuits check good.
Check fuseblock fuse F3 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Press brake ON. At fuse F3, measure voltage at connector (194) from circuit 70C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C, connector (194), then repair.
Brake ON. At flasher plate, circuit 16RED83 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16RED83, connector (J26), then repair.
Brake ON. At flasher plate, circuit 16RED83 and connector (J15), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16RED83, connector (J15), then repair.
Brake ON. At left hand body, circuit 16RED83 and connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16RED83, connector (J9), then repair.
Brake ON. At rear cap, circuit 16RED83 to left stop light and tail light, measure voltage to ground.
16RED83 to left stop light and tail light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16RED83 to left stop light and tail light, then repair. Replace lamp.
Brake ON. At rear cap, circuit 16RED84 to right stop light and tail light, measure voltage to ground.
16RED84 to right stop light and tail light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16RED84 to right stop light and tail light, then repair. Replace lamp.
Stop lights and tail lights checks good.
Check fuseblock fuse F1 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Headlights ON. At fuse F1, measure voltage at connector (194) from circuit 58E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58E, connector (194), then repair.
Headlights ON. At flasher plate, circuit 16BRN83 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BRN83, connector (J26), then repair.
Headlights ON. At flasher plate, circuit 16BRN83 and connector (J15), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BRN83, connector (J15), then repair.
Headlights ON. At left hand body, circuit 16BRN83 and connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BRN83, connector (J9), then repair.
Headlights ON. At rear cap, circuit 16BRN83 to left tail light, measure voltage to ground.
16BRN83 to left tail light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BRN83 to left tail light, then repair. Replace lamp.
Headlights ON. At rear cap, circuit 16BRN84 to right tail light, measure voltage to ground.
16BRN84 to right tail light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BRN84 to right tail light, then repair. Replace lamp.

svcsubproc.title: Left Turn Lights and Right Turn Lights

table.title: Left Turn Lights and Right Turn Lights

entry.para: Check fuseblock fuse F6 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Turn signal switch in left turn. At fuse F6, measure voltage at connector (194) from circuit 56D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56D, connector (194), then repair.
Turn signal switch in left turn. At flasher plate, circuit 16YEL83 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16YEL83, connector (J26), then repair.
Turn signal switch in left turn. At flasher plate, circuit 16YEL83 and connector (J15), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16YEL83, connector (J15), then repair.
Turn signal switch in left turn. At left hand body, circuit 16YEL83 and connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16YEL83, connector (J9), then repair.
Turn signal switch in left turn. At rear cap, circuit 16YEL83 to left rear turn light, measure voltage to ground.
16YEL83 to left rear turn light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16YEL83 to left rear turn light, then repair. Replace lamp.
Turn signal switch in left turn. At front cowl, circuit 16YEL83A to front left turn light and connector (J2), measure voltage to ground.
16YEL83A to front left turn light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16YEL83A to front left turn light, then repair. Replace lamp.
Left turn signal turn lights check good.
Turn signal switch in right turn. At fuse F6, measure voltage at connector (194) from circuit 57D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57D, connector (194), then repair.
Turn signal switch in right turn. At flasher plate, circuit 16GRN84 and connector (J26), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16GRN84, connector (J26), then repair.
Turn signal switch in right turn. At flasher plate, circuit 16GRN84 and connector (J15), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16GRN84, connector (J15), then repair.
Turn signal switch in right turn. At left hand body, circuit 16GRN84 and connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16GRN84, connector (J9), then repair.
Turn signal switch in right turn. At rear cap, circuit 16GRN84 to right turn light, measure voltage to ground.
16GRN84 to right turn light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16GRN84 to right turn light, then repair. Replace lamp.
Turn signal switch in right turn. At front cowl, circuit 16GRN84A to front right turn light and connector (J2), measure voltage to ground.
16GRN84A to right turn light, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16GRN84A to from right turn light, then repair. Replace lamp.
Right turn signal turn lights check good.
Check fuseblock fuse F7 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Turn key to start, transmission in neutral, fuse 7, measure voltage at connector (195), from circuit 17C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 17C, connector (195), then repair.
Hold key in start, at flasher plate, interlock solenoid, circuit 16PNK58 and connector (S47), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK58, connector (S47), then repair.
Hold key in start, at flasher plate, interlock solenoid, circuit 16PNK14 and connector (S47), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK14, connector (S47), then repair.
Hold key in start, at flasher plate, interlock solenoid, circuit 16PNK58 and connector (S16), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16PNK58, interlock solenoid, connector (S16), then repair. Replace interlock solenoid.
At flasher plate, interlock solenoid, circuit 16PNK58 and connector (S16), Measure resistance from connector (S16) through vanalock switch to ground.
Check fuseblock fuses for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Disconnect body harness connector and measure resistance to ground.
Locate cause of short condition, then repair.
Disconnect both ends of harness connector and measure resistance to other connector.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace harness.
Reconnect body harness connectors. Body electrical harness checks good.
Check fuseblock fuse F2 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move clearance/cluster lights switch ON, and at F2 and circuit 16BLK2, connector (J8), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK2, then repair.
Disconnect connector (3) and turn key ON. At (3) circuit 71, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71, then repair.
Disconnect back-up light switch (304) and reconnect conn. (3). At (304) circuit 71, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71, then repair.
Test back-up light switch (304) by placing transmission in reverse, and measuring resistance from black wire to white wire.
Disconnect conn. (3) and reconnect conn. (304). With transmission in reverse, at (3) measure resistance from circuit 71 to 71A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 71A, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (3) and disconnect body builder conn. (194). Turn key ON and with transmission in reverse, measure voltage at (194) from circuit 71A to ground.
OEM back-up light circuits check good.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71A, then repair.
Check fuse panel fuse F22 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Move master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm does not open. At circuit 12RED39, flasher module "start switch" terminal (Weldon) pin 8 or (ELS) pin 6, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 12BLK1, 12RED39 "master and start switches", connectors (J8), (C14), then repair.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm does not open. Check stop arm, circuit 16BLU63 at terminal board (TB1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU63 at terminal board (TB1), then repair.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm does not open. Check stop arm air solenoid, circuit 16BLU63 at terminal board (TB1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in air solenoid circuit 16BLU63 at terminal board (TB1), then repair.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm does not open. Check stop arm relays, microswitches and motor, measure voltage to ground.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm opens to 90 degrees, extends excessively past 90 degrees.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm opens to 90 degrees, but will not return if pushed past 90 degrees.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm operated properly, but continues to run after closing.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm opens properly, but will not close after being switched OFF. Check at stop arm microswitch #3 measure voltage to ground.
Master flasher and start switches ON and stop arm opens properly, but move back and forth about 3 to 4 inches at full open position, "oscillation".
Check fuse panel fuse F22 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Reset or replace fuse.
Move master flasher and start switches ON and crossing gate does not open. At circuit 12RED39, flasher module "start switch" terminal (Weldon) pin 8 or (ELS) pin 6, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 12BLK1, 12RED39 "master and start switches", connectors (J8), (C14), then repair.
Master flasher and start switches ON and crossing gate does not open. Check crossing gate, circuit 16BLK63A at connector (RS3), and circuit 16BLK63 at connector (SS1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLK63 at (RS3), (SS1), then repair.
Master flasher and start switches ON and crossing gate does not open. Check crossing gate and magnet, circuit 16BLU63 at terminal board (TB1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16BLU63 at terminal board (TB1), then repair.
Master flasher and start switches ON and crossing gate does not open. Check crossing gate magnet, circuit 16RED64 at terminal board (TB1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 16RED64 at terminal board (TB1), then repair.
Master flasher and start switches ON and crossing gate does not open. Check crossing gate and magnet, circuit 16WHT to ground.
Locate cause of open crossing gate and magnet circuit 16WHT condition, then repair. Replace crossing gate and magnet.
Master flasher and start switches ON and crossing gate does not open. Check crossing gate magnet.
Crossing gate and magnet check good.
Check fuse panel fuse F31 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F31, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK9 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK9, then repair.
Move driver heater switch to high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK9, connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK9, connector (J9), then repair.
Driver heater switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK9, connector (C19), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK9, connector (C19), then repair.
Driver heater switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED43, connector (J53), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED43, connector (J53), then repair.
Move driver heater switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU42, connector (J53), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU42, connector (J53), then repair.
Check heater control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace heater control switch.
Driver heater switch to low and heater does not operate. Check heater motor, circuit 12WHTA, connector (J53), to ground.
Locate cause of open circuit 12WHTA, connector (J53) condition, then repair.
Check driver heater motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace driver heater motor.
Check fuse panel fuse F36 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F36, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK7 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK7, then repair.
Move defroster switch to high and defroster motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK7, connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK7, connector (J9), then repair.
Defroster switch is high and defroster motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK7, connector (C20), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK7, connector (C20), then repair.
Defroster switch is high and defroster motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED50, connector (J53), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED50, connector (J53), then repair.
Move defroster switch to low and defroster motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU49, connector (J53), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU49, connector (J53), then repair.
Check defroster control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace defroster control switch.
Defroster switch is low and defroster does not operate. check defroster motor, circuit 12WHTB, connector (J53), to ground.
Locate cause of open circuit 12WHTB, connector (J53) condition, then repair.
Check defroster motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace defroster motor.
Check fuse panel fuse F37 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F37, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK8 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK8, then repair.
Move stepwell heater switch to high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK8, connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK8, connector (J9), then repair.
Stepwell heater switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK8, connector (C21), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK8, connector (C21), then repair.
Stepwell heater switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED17, connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED17, connector (J9), then repair.
Stepwell heater switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED17, connector (J2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED17, connector (J2), then repair.
Stepwell heater switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED17, connector (J7), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED17, connector (J7), then repair.
Move stepwell heater switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU16, connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU16, connector (J9), then repair.
Move stepwell heater switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU16, connector (J2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU16, connector (J2), then repair.
Move stepwell heater switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU16, connector (J7), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU16, connector (J7), then repair.
Check heater control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace heater control switch.
Stepwell heater switch to low and heater does not operate. Check heater motor, circuit 12WHT8, connector (J7), to ground.
Locate cause of open circuit 12WHT8, connector (J7) condition, then repair.
Check driver heater motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace driver heater motor.
Check fuse panel fuse F33 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F33, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK10 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK10, then repair.
Move left midship auxiliary switch to high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK10, connector (J81), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK10, connector (J81), then repair.
Left midship auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK10, connector (C17), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK10, connector (C17), then repair.
Left midship auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED23, connector (J81), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED23, connector (J81), then repair.
Move left midship auxiliary switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU22, connector (J81), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU22, connector (J81), then repair.
Check left midship auxiliary control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace left midship auxiliary control switch.
Check left midship auxiliary motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace left midship auxiliary heater motor.
Left midship auxiliary heater circuitry checks good.
Check fuse panel fuse F35 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F35, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK60 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK60, then repair.
Move right midship auxiliary switch to high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK60, connector (J81), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK60, connector (J81), then repair.
Right midship auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK60, connector (C18), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK60, connector (C18), then repair.
Right midship auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED25, connector (J81), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED25, connector (J81), then repair.
Move right midship auxiliary switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU24, connector (J81), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU24, connector (J81), then repair.
Check right midship auxiliary control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace right midship auxiliary control switch.
Check right midship auxiliary motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace right midship auxiliary heater motor.
Right midship auxiliary heater circuitry checks good.
Check fuse panel fuse F34 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F34, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK11 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK11, then repair.
Move left rear auxiliary switch to high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK11, connector (J10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK11, connector (J10), then repair.
Left rear auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK11, connector (C23), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK11, connector (C23), then repair.
Left rear auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED34, connector (J10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED34, connector (J10), then repair.
Move left rear auxiliary switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU33, connector (J10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU33, connector (J10), then repair.
Check left rear auxiliary control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace left rear auxiliary control switch.
Check left rear auxiliary motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace left rear auxiliary heater motor.
Left rear auxiliary heater circuitry checks good.
Check fuse panel fuse F40 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F40, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK61 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK61, then repair.
Move right rear auxiliary switch to high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK61, connector (J54), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK61, connector (J54), then repair.
Right rear auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK61, connector (C24), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK61, connector (C24), then repair.
Right rear auxiliary switch is high and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED38, connector (J54), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED38, connector (J54), then repair.
Move right rear auxiliary switch to low and heater motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU37, connector (J54), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU37, connector (J54), then repair.
Check right rear auxiliary control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace right rear auxiliary control switch.
Check right rear auxiliary motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace right rear auxiliary heater motor.
Right rear auxiliary heater circuitry checks good.
Check fuse panel fuse F6 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F6, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK14 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK14, then repair.
Move booster pump switch to ON and booster pump motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK14, connector (S10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK14, connector (S10), then repair.
Booster pump switch is ON and booster pump motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK14, connector (C22), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK14, connector (C22), then repair.
Booster pump switch is ON and booster pump motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU44, connector (S10), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU44, connector (S10), then repair.
Booster pump switch is ON and booster pump motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU44, connector (RP1), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU44, connector (RP1), then repair.
Booster pump switch is ON and booster pump motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLU44, connector (ES2), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLU44, connector (ES2), then repair.
Check booster pump control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace booster pump control switch.
Booster pump switch to ON and booster pump does not operate. check booster pump motor, circuit 12WHT-, connector (ES2), to ground.
Locate cause of open circuit 12WHT-, connector (ES2) condition, then repair.
Booster pump motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace booster pump motor.
Check fuse panel fuse F5 for open condition. Uses auto reset only (gold body).
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse, with auto reset only (gold body).
At fuse F5, measure voltage from circuit 12BLK12 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK12, then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK12, connector (J3), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK12, connector (J3), then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK12, connector (J5), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK12, connector (J5), then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK12A, connector (J9), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK12A, connector (J9), then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At circuit 12RED, wiper control switch, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12RED, wiper sw., then repair.
Check wiper control switch for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace wiper control switch.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. From splice to circuit 12BLK12A, connector (J5), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage from splice to circuit 12BLK12A, connector (J5), then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK12A, connector (J45), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK12A, connector (J45), then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At black wire to left wiper motor, measure voltage to ground.
Black wire left wiper motor, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire left wiper motor, then repair.
Check left wiper motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace left wiper motor.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. From splice to circuit 12BLK13, connector (J5), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage from splice to circuit 12BLK13, connector (J5), then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At circuit 12BLK13, connector (J46), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12BLK13, connector (J46), then repair.
Move w/s wiper switch ON and w/s wiper motor does not operate. At black wire to right wiper motor, measure voltage to ground.
Black wire right wiper motor, to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire right wiper motor, then repair.
Check right wiper motor for open condition.
Locate cause of open condition, then repair. Replace right wiper motor.
